alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia Basin of Washington (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 9:49PM PST until December 27 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations between five and fifteen hundredths of an inch. * WHERE...Lower Columbia Basin of Washington. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute, and will impact the Interstate 82 and Highway 395 corridors. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest ice accumulation periods are expected to occur Monday morning and Monday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.
